.  The city is the county seat of Clinton County.

From the east:  Follow Interstate 80 west to the Lock Haven exit.  Head north on 220 for seven miles.
From the west:  Follow Interstate 80 east to the Lock Haven exit.  Head north on 220 for seven miles.
From the north:  Follow US 220-South to Lock Haven.
From the South:  Follow Interstate 99/US 220-North to Lock Haven.
Get into a car and drive, or ride your bicycle anywhere in the town.  If you have a boat, you can push off into the West Branch Susquehanna River.
Beautiful fall foliage, high mountain peaks, and Amish farm country are all within 10 minutes of Lock Haven.

value: content=Exhibits about the history of the Piper Aircraft company, as well as a collection of a dozen or so planes, all located on the grounds of the former Piper headquarters and factory.

Check out Avenue 209 Coffee House, with live music and open mic night.  Then visit Lock Haven University.  End your day with a drink at Uncle Albert's tavern, or the Hangar 9.
Texas Hotdogs, or pizza from Checkers.
16oz Stegmaier's for a dollar all day every day at the Hangar 9!
